reviewText: I purchased  Topper  Volume  3  for  $ 7.69.  It is okay if you have never purchased the Topper series but a while back I bought  TV Classics  THE ADVENTURES OF TOPPER  for only  $ 3.99  which  has 9 episodes.  Volume 3  only has 3  episodes  and  2 episodes out of the  3 are in the other DVD.  there is a  bonus episode of Joe  Palooka  which I didn't think is very good.  Buy the  ADVENTURES OF TOPPER.  Is is a lot cheaper and a lot better.
Title: Topper: Volume Three

reviewText: GREAT! JUST GREAT! I think the 40's and 50's are the best! And no filth or sex and the violence is even funny.
Title: Topper: Volume Three

reviewText: Received quickly love the topper movies.  Watched them when I was growing up and my kids love them as its good clean comedy.
Title: Topper: Volume Three

reviewText: topper dvd's are excellent and funny and was great to see it again.thank you
Title: Topper: Volume Three

reviewText: This series of shows from the early days of TV remind us of when TV was actually decent to watch, intelligent, and well-written. Delightful ensemble cast. The dog is a delight. Great family viewing.
Title: Topper: Volume Three

reviewText: We are currently watching these shows as we have a few minutes to stop, put up our feet, and rest.  They are just as enjoyable as the other two volumes.  They are black and white.
Title: Topper: Volume Three

reviewText: great comedy for the entire family.  not seen a bad topper movie. something the whole family can watch together without editing.
Title: Topper: Volume Three

reviewText: It's been decades since I have seen Topper on TV. As someone else stated this is Only Three episodes - and I'll add full of imperfections and NOT restored, and is in Black & White. There are no 'Bonus' features other than 'Joe Palooka' (also Black & White) - some stupid boxing story about 'Joe' going to Mexico to fight - and NOTHING to do with Topper. This DVD should be like in a discount bin for $2.00. The show itself is pretty good given the time period (1950's?). Scott M.
summary: Poor Quality DVD - Video Not Restored
Title: Topper: Volume Three

reviewText: this is when television was still good clean family fun back from the golden age of television from golden era
